item.title: full employment
item.description: Does not mean all resources are used, in fact, there is still some Natural rate of unemployment.

item.title: social aspects of economics
item.description: Education Life expectancy Distribution of income Leisure time Quality of life.

item.title: Universal Basic Income RWE
item.description: Analysis In Finnland, they issued out universal income. The purpose is to reduce poverty and economic inequality. Evaluation The results of the UBI experiment in Finland have been mixed.

item.title: Upsides of Unemployment
item.description: Economics HL Firstly, examine the downsides of too little unemployment: When too many resources of labour are put for one job, each next addition of employee causes a decrease in the ...

item.title: binary threshold
item.description: Method in data analysis of determining whether a data point is above or below a value. There are only two options, hence the name binary.

item.title: central bank
item.description: Government financial institution. Its responsibilities are: Banker to the government Banker to commercial banks Regulator of commercial banks conduct Monetary Policies .

item.title: Supply-Side Policies
item.description: Intends to create long-term growth by moving the aggregate supply curve. The two forms: Market-Based Policies, Interventionist Policies. Objective Promoting long term growth by increasing productive capacity of the economy, improving competition and efficiency, which induces innovation.

item.title: Tradable Permits RWE
item.description: Analysis In 2005, European Union Emission Trading System was implemented. It is a cap and trade system that lead to 40% decrease in emissions since implementation.

item.description: Poverty, Inequality Causes of Poverty and Inequality Impacts of Poverty and Inequality.
